meta.title: The First Ten Numbers & Basic Radicals

layers.visual_etymology: A single horizontal stroke - the simplest possible character. One line = one.
layers.pithy_formula: One proud line sings 'Yeeee!' alone at the top.

characters.story: A single proud line stands alone at the very top of the page, singing 'Yeeee!' in a high, sustained note. It's NUMBER ONE - first place - and it knows it, holding that cheerful high note forever!

bizarreness.sensory: Hear the sustained 'Yeeee!' like a victory cry
bizarreness.absurd_detail: The line wears a tiny gold crown

layers.visual_etymology: Two horizontal strokes stacked. Double the lines = two.
layers.pithy_formula: Two stacked lines yell 'ERR!' - you counted twice!

characters.story: Two parallel lines stack up like bunk beds, and when you count them, they yell 'ERR!' sharply - an error sound! You made the mistake of counting TWICE when you should have known: two lines mean TWO!

bizarreness.absurd_detail: The lines flash red like error messages

layers.visual_etymology: Three horizontal strokes. The pattern continues: three lines = three.
layers.pithy_formula: Three sunny lines sing 'Saaaan-shine!' in harmony.

characters.story: Three horizontal lines rise like stair steps, and they're a trio of singers harmonizing 'Saaaan-shine!' in a high, sustained melody. Three voices, three lines, three parts of a perfect chord singing about the SUN!

layers.visual_etymology: A box (口) with something inside - four legs of a table visible through a window.
layers.pithy_formula: Four legs in a box command 'SEE THIS!' sharply.

characters.story: Look at the box with four items crammed inside! A drill sergeant points sharply and commands 'SEE THIS!' - four things, four corners, four walls of the box containing them. That falling tone is the sergeant's sharp order!

bizarreness.absurd_detail: The box is a glass display case at a museum
bizarreness.action: Sergeant's finger jabbing at exactly four objects

similar_warning.difference: 四 has internal strokes; 西 has a horizontal line through it

layers.visual_etymology: Abstract representation of five fingers crossing at the palm.

characters.story: Five strokes converge like five fingers meeting at the palm, and they whisper a ghostly 'Woooo...' with that low, dipping tone. It's a spooky hand reaching out with FIVE fingers, murmuring in the dark!

bizarreness.absurd_detail: The hand glows pale green in darkness
bizarreness.action: Fingers slowly curling, counting one by one

layers.visual_etymology: A lid (亠) on top of eight (八) - but it's SIX, not eight!
layers.pithy_formula: Leo the lion roars 'SIX!' under his lid-mane.

characters.story: Leo the Lion wears his glorious mane (the lid on top) and ROARS his number sharply: 'LEOOOO!' - which sounds like 'liù'! He's number SIX in the animal kingdom rankings, and that falling tone is his commanding roar!

bizarreness.action: Mane flowing like a lid catching wind

layers.visual_etymology: A horizontal line cut by a hook - like cutting something in half, plus a bit more.
layers.pithy_formula: Seven sparklers squeak 'CHEE!' slashing the night sky.

characters.story: SEVEN kids wave sparklers on the 7th of July, slashing bright lines across the night sky! They squeak 'CHEE! CHEE! CHEE!' in high-pitched delight - seven voices, seven sparklers, all singing that sustained high note!

bizarreness.absurd_detail: Sparklers write the number 7 in fire
bizarreness.action: Kids jumping while slashing the air

layers.visual_etymology: Two strokes spreading apart - splitting, dividing, like 8 split in half = 4+4.
layers.pithy_formula: Eight sheep paths split apart, bleating 'BAAAA!'

characters.story: EIGHT sheep stand at a fork in the road where paths SPLIT apart (just like the character!), and they all bleat 'BAAAA!' in a high, sustained chorus! Eight sheep, eight fleeces, eight voices bleating that long 'bā' sound!

bizarreness.absurd_detail: Each sheep wears a number 1-8 on their wool
bizarreness.action: Paths physically spreading like opening scissors

similar_warning.difference: 八 strokes separate outward; 入 strokes point inward

layers.visual_etymology: A bent stroke with a hook - like a snake curving, or the number 9 itself.
layers.pithy_formula: Nine hooks curl and murmur 'Jiuuu...' like a cat.

characters.story: NINE cats curl up on a couch, each one bent into a hook shape (just like 九!), and they purr a low, dipping 'Jiuuu...' sound. That third tone dips down like a cat settling into its curled position!

bizarreness.absurd_detail: Each cat has a number tag: Cat #9, Cat #9, etc.

similar_warning.difference: 九 has an open hook; 丸 has a dot inside

layers.visual_etymology: A simple cross - the Roman numeral X rotated, or counting sticks crossed.
layers.pithy_formula: A cross asks 'Shi? Why TEN?' with rising wonder.

characters.story: A CROSS marks the spot where TEN treasures are buried! It keeps asking 'Shi? Why ten? Why here?' with that rising, questioning tone. That's how we remember: the cross wonders about the number TEN!

bizarreness.sensory: X marks treasure map, paper crinkle
bizarreness.absurd_detail: The cross wears reading glasses while pondering

layers.visual_etymology: A square representing an open mouth - one of the most common radicals.
layers.pithy_formula: A square mouth whispers 'Kooou...' pondering speech.

characters.story: Your MOUTH forms a perfect square (say 'oh' and look in a mirror!), and it whispers 'Kooou...' with that low, dipping third tone. The mouth contemplates: what words should I speak? That's 口 - the MOUTH radical!

bizarreness.absurd_detail: The square mouth has tiny hinges at corners
bizarreness.action: Opening and closing in slow motion

similar_warning.difference: 口 is smaller and means mouth; 囗 is larger and means enclosure

layers.visual_etymology: A box with a line inside - the sun with a spot (or the horizon).
layers.pithy_formula: The SUN box yells 'REEE!' - commanding you awake!

characters.story: The SUN is a box of pure light with a bar of energy inside, and every DAY it YELLS 'REEE!' sharply to wake you up! That fourth tone is the sun's commanding morning alarm - get up, it's a new DAY!

bizarreness.action: Rays shooting out like exclamation points

similar_warning.difference: 日 has one internal line (sun); 目 has two internal lines (eyelids)

layers.visual_etymology: A crescent moon with two marks inside - lunar phases or craters.
layers.pithy_formula: The crescent MOON commands 'YUE!' - marking the month.

characters.story: The crescent MOON hangs in the sky and commands 'YUE!' with a sharp falling tone, marking the passage of each MONTH! The moon is time's commander, ordering the calendar to turn. One full cycle = one month!

bizarreness.absurd_detail: Moon holds a calendar, flipping pages sharply
bizarreness.action: Crescent like a conductor's baton sweeping down

layers.visual_etymology: A square divided into four plots - aerial view of rice paddies.

tone_emotion.quality: rising, wondering, curious about the harvest

layers.pithy_formula: Four muddy plots ask 'TIAN? Why so muddy?'

characters.story: Looking down at a RICE FIELD divided into four square plots, the farmer wonders with a rising tone: 'Tián? Why is my field so muddy today?' That questioning second tone rises like steam from the wet paddies!

bizarreness.absurd_detail: Each plot has a tiny question mark growing in it
bizarreness.action: Farmer scratching head while looking down

similar_warning.difference: 田 is enclosed; 由 extends below the box

layers.visual_etymology: An eye turned sideways - two horizontal lines are the eyelids.
layers.pithy_formula: The EYE yells 'MOO!' sharply when dust gets in!

characters.story: Your EYE is a rectangle with two eyelid lines inside, and when DUST gets in, it YELLS 'MOO!' sharply with that falling fourth tone - an involuntary shout of pain! The eye commands tears to flush it out!

bizarreness.absurd_detail: The eye has tiny arms rubbing itself

similar_warning.difference: 目 has two internal lines (eyelids); 日 has one internal line (sun)
